ROS1.llm_output: The text mentions that further therapeutic developments are ongoing for genetic abnormalities involving the fusion gene ROS1 in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma.

rtk_ras_pi3k_akt_signaling.llm_output: The abstract indicates that MEK1 inhibition in a mouse model of KRAS-driven pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) leads to sustained activation of the PI3K-AKT-MTOR pathway and activation of receptor tyrosine kinases (RTK).

rb_pathway.llm_output: The first abstract describes a case of pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PDAC) in a patient with a germline RB1 pathogenic variant, suggesting that biallelic loss of RB1 is an alternative mechanism by which the RB1-pathway can be disrupted in PDAC.

cell_cycle_pathway.llm_output: The abstract with PMID 41187942 mentions that Asian patients with Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma had fewer cell-cycle-related mutations compared to White and Black patients.

hippo_pathway.llm_output: The abstract with PMID 40436845 states that dysregulation of the Hippo signaling pathway is observed in pancreatic adenocarcinoma (PAAD).

myc_pathway.llm_output: The article with PMID 40964310 states that MondoA mediates transcriptional coordination between the MYC network and the integrated stress response in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

notch_pathway.llm_output: The text with PMID 39709423 and 39561094 mentions that the Notch pathway is associated with Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma.

pi3k_pathway.llm_output: The abstracts mention that the PI3K pathway is associated with Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC), with one abstract stating that Xihuang Pill (XHP) might regulate multi-target and influence the PI3K/AKT pathway for PDAC treatment and another stating that PTEN oxidation promotes constitutive PI3K signaling in pancreatic cancer.

rtk_ras_pathway.llm_output: The text mentions that poor prognosis was associated with higher TC2N mRNA levels in pancreatic adenocarcinoma and that TC2N transcription was positively correlated with transcription of several other cancer genes including genes from RAS/RTK pathways.

tp53_pathway.llm_output: The article titled "Chemotherapy enhances HMGA1 secretion through the mutant p53-CK2 axis in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells" associates the tp53 pathway with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

wnt_pathway.llm_output: The article titled "CDK4/6 and BET inhibitors synergistically suppress pancreatic tumor growth and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition by regulating the GSK3β-mediated Wnt/β-catenin pathway" associates the Wnt pathway with Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma.

cell_cycle_control.llm_output: The abstract mentions that UTD1 induced apoptosis and caused G2/M arrest dose-dependently, indicating an effect on cell cycle progression in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

p53_signaling.llm_output: The article titled "Novel dual responsive embelin functionalised ZnO nanomaterials amplify DNA damage and induce apoptosis via pERK1/2/p53 pathway in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma" associates the p53 signaling pathway with Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma.

notch_signaling.llm_output: The text mentions that targeting pathways like Notch and Hedgehog offers a promising avenue to enhance drug penetration and efficacy in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

dna_damage_response.llm_output: The article titled "DNA Damage and Repair in Pancreatic Cancer-The Latest Findings" discusses the link between DNA damage, DNA repair, and the development and progression of pancreatic cancer.

other_growth_proliferation_signaling.llm_output: Collagen XVII promotes Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma tumor growth through regulation of PIK3R5.

survival_cell_death_regulation_signaling.llm_output: The study in PMID:40943389 demonstrates that AS1411 aptamer-conjugated liposomal siRNA targeting MTA2 suppresses PI3K/AKT signaling in pancreatic cancer cells, indicating an association between survival cell death regulation signaling and Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma.

rtk_signaling_family.llm_output: The second abstract states that angiogenin (ANG) can trigger oncogenic transformation via direct association with EGFR, a member of the receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) family, in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

pi3k_akt_mtor_signaling.llm_output: The abstracts consistently associate the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway with Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma, indicating its involvement in tumor growth, metastasis, and therapeutic resistance.

angiogenesis.llm_output: The first abstract mentions that HypoxamiRs modulate cellular pathways that promote tumor survival and angiogenesis in pancreatic cancer.

invasion_and_metastasis.llm_output: The abstract states that chemotherapy may select for cancer cells with increased capacity for invasion and metastasis in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

tgf_\u03b2_pathway.llm_output: The abstracts indicate that the TGF-β pathway is associated with Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma, with one abstract stating that BMP2 may serve as a therapeutic target in specific tumors via TGF-β signaling modulation and another stating that TGF-β signaling plays a major role in tumor progression.

regulation_of_ribosomal_protein_synthesi.llm_output: The abstract with PMID 41041073 indicates that hsa_circ_0058495 promotes PDAC progression by stabilizing IGF2BP2, which enhances the stability of MEKK1 mRNA, leading to sustained ERK1/2 phosphorylation and consequent promotion of PDAC cell proliferation and invasion.

Squamous.llm_output: The text states that SP140L is linked to poor prognosis in pancreatic adenocarcinoma, which implies an association.

Pancreatic Progenitor.llm_output: The first abstract states that bulk transcriptomic profiling has identified two major gene expression-based molecular subtypes of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC): classical/progenitor and basal-like/squamous/quasimesenchymal.

Aberrantly Differentiated Endocrine Exoc.llm_output: The text states that expression analysis defined four subtypes of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinomas, including the aberrantly differentiated endocrine exocrine (ADEX) subtype.

Basal-like.llm_output: The first abstract states that bulk transcriptomic profiling has identified two major gene expression-based molecular subtypes of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC): classical/progenitor and basal-like/squamous/quasimesenchymal.

Classical.llm_output: The first abstract states that bulk transcriptomic profiling has identified two major gene expression-based molecular subtypes of Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC): classical/progenitor and basal-like/squamous/quasimesenchymal.

Exocrine-like.llm_output: The text from PMID:36550235 states that integrated clustering identified an exocrine-like subtype of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma.

rtk_ras_pi3k_akt_signaling.llm_output: The first abstract mentions that inhibitors of PI3K, AKT, and mTOR exhibit promising efficacy against various cancers such as Invasive Breast Cancer, Lymphoma, Neoplasms, and Hematological malignancies, indicating an association between the RTK/RAS/PI3K/AKT signaling pathway and Invasive Breast Carcinoma.

rb_pathway.llm_output: The abstract from PMID:38678032 mentions that the cell-autonomous E2F1/4-pRb/RBL2 axis regulates self-renewal, chemoresistance and invasiveness of CSCs in both PDAC and breast cancer.

myc_pathway.llm_output: The meta-analysis identified MYC as a target gene of miR-21, which is involved in proliferation in breast cancer.

pi3k_pathway.llm_output: The abstract with PMID 41057074 states that ATXN3 modulates tumor progression through critical signaling cascades such as the PI3K/Akt pathway in breast cancer.

rtk_ras_pathway.llm_output: MRI-based radiogenomics analysis exhibits excellent performance in predicting genetic pathways alterations, including RTK/RAS, in invasive breast carcinoma.

tp53_pathway.llm_output: The text mentions that pathogenic alterations in TP53 pathways were observed in 86.3% of residual triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) samples, which is a subtype of Invasive Breast Carcinoma.

cell_cycle_control.llm_output: The article with PMID 40882873 associates the PHKA1 gene, involved in glucose metabolism, with cell cycle markers and breast cancer.

p53_signaling.llm_output: The abstract states that FAM27E3 promotes PTC lymph node metastasis related to the p53 signaling pathway.

other_growth_proliferation_signaling.llm_output: Invasive Breast Carcinoma is associated with the modulation of SMYD2-EZH2-STAT3 signaling pathway.

survival_cell_death_regulation_signaling.llm_output: The text states that ADH1A overexpression may attenuate the malignant characteristics of TNBC cells by inhibiting the Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathway, indicating an association between survival cell death regulation signaling and Invasive Breast Carcinoma.

rtk_signaling_family.llm_output: The article with PMID 30087699 discusses subtyping of Triple Negative Breast Carcinoma on the basis of RTK expression, indicating an association between RTK signaling and this cancer type, which is a subtype of Invasive Breast Carcinoma.

pi3k_akt_mtor_signaling.llm_output: The abstracts provided associate the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway with breast cancer, including triple-negative breast cancer, and its progression.

ras_raf_mek_erk_jnk_signaling.llm_output: The text states that Ras-Raf-MEK-Erk/JNK signaling co-occurs with RET alterations, and RET expression is significantly increased in breast invasive carcinoma (BRCA).

Luminal A.llm_output: The text states that biomarkers were available for 33 occult malignancies (OMs), of which 21 (64%) were luminal A.

Luminal B.llm_output: The study classifies tumors into Luminal A, Luminal B (HER2-negative and HER2-positive), and triple-negative subtypes, indicating an association between Luminal B molecular subtype and Invasive Breast Carcinoma.

HER2-enriched.llm_output: The text states that an echogenic rind was associated with invasive cancer molecular subtype HER2-enriched in breast cancer patients.

Basal-like.llm_output: The text states that FOXC1 promotes the aggressive basal-like phenotype in triple-negative breast cancer.

Claudin-low.llm_output: The text states that Fbln2 mRNA expression is higher in claudin-low breast cancers compared to other subgroups and that RSK3 expression is correlated with EMT and invasion in human claudin-low breast tumors.

Triple-negative.llm_output: The abstracts mention that the Triple-negative molecular subtype is associated with Invasive Breast Carcinoma.
